intro: Sphaerostigma tortuosum, commonly known as the twisted spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally twisted stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences called cyathia. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating. Sphaerostigma tortuosum is adapted to grow in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along roadsides.
